frame.name: Namesake
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> shares a name with its <fen>Namesake</fen>. Note that the shared name is not a frame element as it cannot be directly expressed as an argument of the target lexical units in this frame.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Alberta's</fex> <t>namesake</t> caught in royal scandal</ex> <ex><fex name="Namesake"> <t>namesake</t></fex> caught in royal scandal</ex> <ex>Instead, the <t>eponymous</t> <fex name="Entity">character</fex> is a mildly retarded woman, Martha (Winger), whose simplistic view on life places her in ethically compromising positions. <fex name="Namesake">DNI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Namesake">He</fex> is <fex name="Entity">my</fex> <t>namesake</t>, one amongst the many described in my homepage, and is much better qualified to write a page like this.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> about whom it is asserted that they share a name with a <fen>Namesake</fen>.
<ex> Homer's mythical enchantress was a weaver, and so is <fex name="ent">her</fex> <t>namesake</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Namesake
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person or thing that has the same name as the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="nam">Claire</fex> is her <t>namesake</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Anchor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A domain, often a place or time, in which the <fen>Namesake</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen> is located.
<ex>Karam is a member of the Parti Socialiste Guyanais (PSG), which has long been the strongest political party and is allied to its <fex name="anc">French</fex> <t>namesake</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any temporary or permanent property of the <fen>Namesake</fen>.
<ex>Adalvard the younger had visited and buried his <fex name="desc">elder</fex> <t>namesake</t> in 1060.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: namesake.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person or thing that has the same name as another.
